sentence: Led by gains in the retail and energy sectors, the benchmark indices set new record highs on Tuesday.
Dow component stocks Walmart ( WMT ) and Home Depot ( HD ) were leading advancers after both beat Q4 EPS and revenue expectations, setting the retail sector of the S&P 500 up for a near 1% gain.
Bullish quarterly results from the retail sector compensated for a miss on the purchasing manager's indices for both the services and manufacturing sector.
The flash February services PMI fell to 53.9 from January's 55.6, missing 55.8 estimates.
At the same time, the manufacturing index dropped to 54.3 from 55.0 previously, below the 55.3 projections.

Oil futures were underpinned by production forecasts after members of the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries honored recent production cuts, with non-OPEC members expected to respect production levels.
Accordingly, Brent crude oil futures were 1.50% higher with its domestic counterpart, West Texas Intermediate, higher by nearly 2% per barrel.
In Europe, upbeat manufacturing data resulted in a record high in the German Dax and lifted the Euro-Stoxx 600 by more than 0.60%.
The Euro-zone PMI manufacturing index rose to 55.5 from 55.2 in January, while the comparable German index shot up to 57.0 from 56.4, both of which were better than market expectations.
Crude oil was up $0.96 to $54.36 per barrel.
Natural gas was down $0.19 to $2.76 per 1 million BTU.
Gold was down $0.70 to $1,238.40 an ounce, while silver was down $0.02 to $18.08 an ounce.
Copper was up $0.04 to $2.76 per pound.
Among energy ETFs, the United States Oil Fund was up 1.93% to $11.60 with the United States Natural Gas Fund was down 5.00% to $6.66.
Amongst precious-metal funds, the Market Vectors Gold Miners ETF was down 0.69% to 24.62 while SPDR Gold Shares were up 0.12% to $117.83.
The iShares Silver Trust was up 0.02% to $17.08.

Here's where the markets stand at mid-day:

NYSE Composite Index was up 37.80 points (+0.33%) to 11,548.71

Dow Jones Industrial Index was up 85.28 points (+0.42%) to 20,710.99

S&P 500 was up 8/60 points (+0.37%) to 2,359.74

Nasdaq Composite Index was up 15.43 points (+0.26%) to 5,853.88

FTSE 100 was up 25.03 points (-0.34%) to 7,274.83

DAX was up 139.87 points (+1.18%) to 11,967.49

CAC 40 was up 23.77 points (+0.49%) to 4,888.76

Nikkei 225 was up 130.36 points (+0.68%) to 19,381.44

Hang Seng Index was down 182.45 points (-0.76%) to 23,963.63

Shanghai China Composite Index was up 13.36 points (+0.41%) to 3,253.33

NYSE Energy Sector Index was up 97.79 points (+0.89%) to 11,066.19

NYSE Financial Sector Index was up 15.32 points (+0.21%) to 7,356.39

NYSE Healthcare Sector Index was up 32.31 points (+0.26%) to 12,605.18

(+) EYEG (+61.60%) Agreed to exclusive marketing agreement with Valeant ( VRX ) for Eye Gate II Delivery System and EGP-437

(+) TROX (+29.57%) Announced acquisition of Cristal's TiO2 business for $1.673 billion in cash, reported lighter-than-expected Q4 loss

(+) DGAS (+15.68%) Agrees to be acquired Peoples Natural Gas for $30.50 per share

(-) CDTX (-38.25%) Topical formulation of CD101 failed to demonstrate a sufficient treatment effect in phase 2 clinical trial

(-) TRVN (-34.64%) Reported positive development in phase 3 Apollo-1 and Apollo-2 trials, but results showed lower rates of depressed breathing and only statistically significant observation was found in the lowest dose
